recipes.title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: A quick and easy Italian pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper.

instructions.description: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add spaghetti and cook until al dente, about 8-10 minutes.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crisp, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Parmesan cheese until well combined.
Drain the spaghetti, reserving 1 cup of the pasta water.
Add the hot spaghetti to the skillet with pancetta. Remove from heat and quickly pour the egg and cheese mixture over the pasta, tossing to coat.
Add reserved pasta water a little at a time to achieve a creamy consistency.
Season with freshly ground black pepper and salt to taste. Serve immediately.

recipes.notes: For a vegetarian version, omit the pancetta and add sautéed mushrooms instead.

recipes.title: Chicken Alfredo
recipes.description: A rich and creamy pasta dish with grilled chicken, Parmesan cheese, and a smooth Alfredo sauce.

instructions.description: Cook fettuccine according to package instructions.
In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add minced garlic and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add heavy cream to the skillet and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat and cook until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Add cooked fettuccine and sliced grilled chicken to the skillet. Toss to coat with sauce.
Serve immediately, garnished with chopped parsley.

recipes.notes: For a lighter version, use half-and-half instead of heavy cream.

recipes.title: Margherita Pizza
recipes.description: A classic Italian pizza topped with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, basil, and olive oil.

instructions.description: Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C). Place a pizza stone or baking sheet in the oven to preheat.
Stretch out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface to form a round shape.
Transfer the dough to a parchment paper-lined baking sheet or a pizza peel dusted with cornmeal.
Arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella cheese over the dough.
Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly, about 10-12 minutes.
Remove from the oven and top with fresh basil leaves. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and black pepper.
Slice and serve immediately.

recipes.notes: For a crispy crust, preheat the pizza stone or baking sheet in the oven before placing the pizza on it.

recipes.title: Tacos al Pastor
recipes.description: Traditional Mexican tacos made with marinated pork, pineapple, onions, and cilantro.

instructions.description: In a bowl, combine sliced pork shoulder with salt, pepper, and your favorite taco seasoning. Let marinate for at least 1 hour or overnight in the refrigerator.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill the marinated pork slices until cooked through and slightly charred, about 3-4 minutes per side.
Warm the corn tortillas on the grill for about 30 seconds per side.
To assemble the tacos, place a few slices of grilled pork on each tortilla. Top with diced pineapple, chopped onion, and fresh cilantro.
Serve hot with lime wedges, salsa verde, and your favorite toppings.

recipes.notes: For authentic flavor, use a vertical rotisserie to cook the pork, and grill the pineapple slices before dicing.
